result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon Ross Marsala was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Endanger Safety/Use/Dangerous Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(a).
  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Brandon Ross Marsala in court with attorney Mark D. Lawton.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Lawton states matter is resolved.  State notes victim was noticed and then states recs.  VIS provided to parties.  Atty Lawton agrees w/recs as stated.  State moves to amend Count 1.  Court so orders.  Atty Lawton enters NC pleas to all 3 counts.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on plea/accepts/finds guilty.  Parties review VIS.  Court sentences.

Ct 1:  ***Amended to 941.20(1)(a) - NC
Ct 2 and 3:  NC
Probation on all 3 counts for 2 years concurrent to each other and any other probation
Ct 1 ONLY:  120 days jail w/huber consecutive to any other sentence
To commence on or before 7/14/2015 at 6:00 pm unless agent directs otherwise
No contact with K.L.G, A.C, H.N.M. or J.R.W.
Costs of $443.00 x 3 to be paid during probation per agent
